title: Step 1: Add empty Pickup Point Dashboard route with placeholder page

requirements.text: Create a new Pickup Point Dashboard page component that renders placeholder content only (no backend calls, no listing queries, no order/cart actions). The page must include a clear H1 title and short description indicating this is the upcoming pickup-point dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: A new page component exists under frontend/src/pages/shop for the pickup-point dashboard.
When rendered, the page shows a visible title (H1) and a short English placeholder description.
The page does not import or call any data-fetching hooks (React Query) or actor methods.
The page renders without runtime errors and uses existing layout conventions (e.g., container-custom + spacing) consistent with other shop pages.

requirements.text: Add a new authenticated route for the Pickup Point Dashboard in the TanStack router configuration (frontend/src/router/HashRouter.tsx). The route must be protected by RequireAuth and render the new placeholder Pickup Point Dashboard page at a stable path (e.g., /pickup-point-dashboard).

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /pickup-point-dashboard while logged out shows the existing login gate (RequireAuth behavior).
Navigating to /pickup-point-dashboard while logged in renders the new placeholder pickup-point dashboard page.
The new route is included in the router's routeTree so it is reachable at runtime.
No other routes, dashboards, or role-approval guards are changed in this step.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui/*.
Keep Step 1 minimal: do not add backend methods, React Query hooks, listing sorting, or order creation in this build step.
nonGoals: Implementing pickup-point role approval gating/guards for the new route.
Adding pickup-point navigation links/buttons in the header or elsewhere.
Fetching or displaying listings (including town prioritization).
